author: PaulHigin
body: WinRM (Windows only) based remoting tests require either a default or custom PowerShell endpoint, and currently endpoints are based on built-in PowerShell 5.1.  Consequently many remoting tests do not work correctly and must be disabled.  We should disable them in a consistent way, I think by using the -Pending switch.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Instead of marking them `Pending`, we may be able to fix them after https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/2671 gets merged

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: I somehow missed that PR, but yes part of that work should be to update all remoting tests so that they run on the new endpoints.  I'll take a look at the PR this week.

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: Actually, that work is incomplete.  We need to make all remoting cmdlets work, not just Enable-PSRemoting.  I'll comment on the PR.

title: Remoting tests that target PowerShell 5.1 should be disabled consistently
